name: Layer Two Amsterdam
description: A two-day technical conference dedicated to Ethereum L2 Scaling. Meet industry leaders: builders and developers, learn during talks and panels and dig deeper by attending workshops.

sessions.name: How we are building the zkEVM

speakers.name: Jordi Baylina
speakers.description: Jordi leads the technical development of the Polygon Hermez zkRollup and is currently working on the implementation of the zkEVM. He is the co-founder of the White Hat Group, the author of the MiniMe token contract, the elliptic curves Solidity library, as well as numerous other established contracts in the Ethereum space. Jordi is also a well-respected auditor as well as the co-founder of the donation platform Giveth, DAppNode, Iden3 and most recently, Polygon Hermez.

sessions.name: Polygon Nightfall and testnet launch update

speakers.name: Chaitanya Konda
speakers.description: Chaitanya is a Cryptography and Blockchain Researcher working in EY's Blockchain R&D team. She works on scalable privacy solutions for public blockchains. She led the development of Nightfall 1 project and currently is leading the deployment of Polygon Nightfall to mainnet in partnership with Polygon.

sessions.name: Building Scalable L2s with ZK

speakers.name: Brendan Farmer
speakers.description: Brendan studied math and philosophy before starting Mir, a ZK L1 designed to provide privacy and scalability. The Mir team joined Polygon, becoming Polygon Zero, and released Plonky2, which set a new benchmark for ZKP performance. Polygon Zero is focused on building a scalable ZK L2 to onboard the next billion users to Ethereum.

sessions.name: Miden VM: the heart of Polygon Miden

speakers.name: Bobbin Threadbare
speakers.description: Bobbin Threadbare is a project lead for Polygon Miden. Prior to joining Polygon, Bobbin was a core ZK researcher at Facebook's Novi where he led the development of Winterfell, a highly-performant STARK prover and verifier. Bobbin has made numerous contributions to the STARK-based systems including genSTARK library, Distaff VM, as well as AirScript and AirAssembly languages.

sessions.name: Anonymity for a billion people

speakers.name: Remco Bloemen
speakers.description: Desire: To see humanity explore and enjoy the full extend of what is possible within the limits of the laws of physics, and to find ways to hack around those limitations where I can!

sessions.name: A look into the zk-evm

speakers.name: Olivier Begassat
speakers.description: Olivier Bégassat is part of the ConsenSys Applied Research RnD team. His current interest is around developping a zk-evm.

speakers.name: Théodore Chapuis-Chkaiban
speakers.description: Theodore Chapuis-Chkaiban is an applied researcher in Cryptography at ConsenSys Protocols R&D team. His research interests lie at the intersection of cryptography and computer architecture design. He is the co-author of a paper recently published on EthResearch specifying a model for a zk-EVM which is currently being implemented.

sessions.name: zkEVM challenges and solutions

speakers.name: Ye Zhang
speakers.description: Ye Zhang is the co-founder and zk-researcher at Scroll Tech. He used to work on hardware acceleration for ZKP algorithms and theoretical constructions behind ZKP protocols. Now his focus is on optimizing the zkEVM.

sessions.name: Do we need zkEVM equivalence or is EVM compatibility sufficient?

speakers.name: Justin Drake
speakers.description: Justin is a researcher at the Ethereum Foundation.

speakers.name: Ye Zhang
speakers.description: Ye Zhang is the co-founder and zk-researcher at Scroll Tech. He used to work on hardware acceleration for ZKP algorithms and theoretical constructions behind ZKP protocols. Now his focus is on optimizing the zkEVM.

speakers.name: Jordi Baylina
speakers.description: Jordi leads the technical development of the Polygon Hermez zkRollup and is currently working on the implementation of the zkEVM. He is the co-founder of the White Hat Group, the author of the MiniMe token contract, the elliptic curves Solidity library, as well as numerous other established contracts in the Ethereum space. Jordi is also a well-respected auditor as well as the co-founder of the donation platform Giveth, DAppNode, Iden3 and most recently, Polygon Hermez.

speakers.name: Ohad Barta
speakers.description: Ohad Barta has been a product manager at StarkWare for two years. He is involved in numerous projects building on both StarkNet and StarkEx. Ohad came to StarkWare with 9 years of prior experience in theoretical cryptography and code development.

sessions.name: Starknet dApps: How we built DeFi 3.0 with Cairo

speakers.name: Vitaly Yakovlev
speakers.description: Vitaly is the CTO at ZKX, where he leads all aspects of the technology and innovation of a suite of Web3 products. He is a strategic, business-driven leader with 20+ years of experience and specializes in developing operational strategies to assure business growth through emerging technologies and product-market-fit.

sessions.name: Why account abstraction on L2 matters

speakers.name: Julien Niset
speakers.description: Julien is the Chief Science Officer and co-founder of Argent. He holds a PhD in Physics from Université libre de Bruxelles with a focus on Quantum Information and Quantum Cryptography. He has authored several publications in leading peer reviewed scientific journals and is the author of three patents: for quantum random number generation, distribution and use in novel cryptographic schemes.

sessions.name: Choosing an L2 solution for the Tornado Cash Nova dapp

speakers.name: Alexey Pertsev
speakers.description: Security auditor and solidity dev. Worked on many dapps including Tornado Cash.

sessions.name: A history and present-day overview of Ethereum scaling solutions

speakers.name: Valeria Yermakova
speakers.description: Product Design Lead at Arbitrum, former web2 founder, current handstand aficionado.

sessions.name: L2: Our one chance to fix the mistakes of the past

speakers.name: Barry Whitehat
speakers.description: Barry has been working with ethereum since January 2016. He has developed dapps . He has had bugs accepted to the ethereum foundation's bug bounty. And performed security reviews of numerous projects. More recently he has become interested in zksnarks.

sessions.name: A note on bridges and layer-2

speakers.name: Patrick McCorry
speakers.description: Patrick McCorry is an Engineer (more like Intern) at Infura. He was an Assistant Professor at King's College London in Cryptocurrencies and Security Engineering. As well, he was a researcher at University College London, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and Newcastle University.

sessions.name: True Bridges vs Liquidity Networks

speakers.name: Vaibhav Chellani
speakers.description: Ethereum Researcher, Co-Founder@SocketDotTech, L2 guy.

sessions.name: Rollup Glue - enabling users on L2 to access cross-chain DeFi

speakers.name: Will Harborne
speakers.description: Will is the founder of DeversiFi, an application specific L2 powered by zero-knowledge proofs, as well as the co-founder of ZKValidator. DeversiFi is focused on making DeFi yield and trading opportunities accessible from one easy and low-friction interface.

sessions.name: Improving Rollups: The Power of State Pools

speakers.name: Jacobo Toll-Messia
speakers.description: Jacobo Toll-Messia, Founder and CEO at Nahmii AS, was a managing consultant for IBM Global Business services before launching Nahmi AS. At IBM, he specialized in product and business development, strategic planning, distributed systems, and data management. Before that, he was a program manager and country manager at Epsis. Jacobo is a thought leader and expert in cryptocurrency, blockchain, and the Web3 industry.

sessions.name: DeFi security issues when building on L2s

speakers.name: Anton Permenev
speakers.description: Anton Permenev is a founding security engineer at ChainSecurity, who performed numerous audits of DeFi protocols. He is also interested in formal verification and automated security analysis of the smart contracts.

sessions.name: Developing Smart Contracts in Sway

speakers.name: Emily Herbert
speakers.description: Emily is a compiler engineer at Fuel Labs, working on the Sway compiler. She holds a MS in Computer Science from the University of Massachusetts Amherst and was a PhD student at Northeastern University (before she dropped out), where she specialized in programming languages and compilers work. Before joining Fuel Labs, Emily spent time at both Google and NASA, focusing on combining the domains of programming languages and networking.

sessions.name: Optimism beyond Ethereum: EVM in non-EVM chains

speakers.name: Daniel Kmak
speakers.description: Blockchain developer at Nervos. Currently focused on UTXO-blockchains and EVM rollups. In the space since 2017. Previously worked for Ethereum Alarm Clock, Polymath, Energy Web Foundation.

sessions.name: Gas prices at the L2 pump getting you down? Carpool with BLS Wallet!

speakers.name: Jacob Caban-Tomski
speakers.description: Developer working on scaling solutions using L2s for Ethereum to lower costs and enable more people from around world to participate and enjoy the benefits of using Web3.

sessions.name: The Layer 2 Tooling Landscape: Where We Are and Where We're (Hopefully) Going

speakers.name: Faina Shalts
speakers.description: Faina Shalts is a Lead Blockchain Engineer at ConsenSys. Since joining in 2018, she has worked on Truffle’s open source tool suite. She now leads the Layer 2/Scaling team at Truffle, seeking to make Layer 2 adoption as easy as possible for developers.
